paper.title: A Hybrid GRA/MV Model for the Automatic Selection of Investment Portfolios with Minimum Risk and Maximum Return
paper.abstract: In the proposed approach, financial data are collected automatically and are input to a GM(1,1) prediction model to forecast the future trends of the collected data. The forecast data are then reduced using a GM(1,N) model; classified using a K-Means clustering algorithm, and processed by a Rough Set (RS) classification module which selects appropriate investment stocks. Finally, a Minimum Variance At Risk (MVAR) scheme comprising five Grey Relational Analysis (GRA) models and the Markowitz means-variance (MV) model is employed to identify the efficient, frontier which achieves the optimal tradeoff between the minimum risk and the maximum rate of return.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是使用GRA/MV模型自动选择投资组合，以实现最小风险和最大回报的目标，这直接属于投资组合管理的范畴。
